intro: Eriotheca hassleri, commonly known as the Hassler's eriotheca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture. Eriotheca hassleri is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
